When two objects collide, their momenta are conserved, and some energy may be transferred depending on whether the collision is elastic or inelastic.
If the collision is elastic, both momentum and kinetic energy are conserved. If it's inelastic, only momentum is conserved, and some kinetic energy is lost as heat or deformation.
